Description: Neck sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora; interior glazed black with two pairs of added red bands; exterior, from top: trace of black band on groove; below, black-figure decoration consisting of crane to left (part of body and part of one leg remaining with red on wing and added white dots on feather).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Cranes are commonly found decorating the necks of amphorae from the Tübingen Group. For parallels regarding the decoration, see Berlin Inv. 4530 from Benha.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 12, no. 5, pl. 3, no. 5)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 125, no. 18)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.088) (phase 3)
